com.snap2d.world

Class World2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.world.World2D
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GLWorld2D, ScrollWorld, TiledWorld2D

    public class World2D
extends Object
    Provides a method of interfacing between the screen and 2-dimensional world coordinate systems. World2D creates a "viewport" of a standard Cartesian coordinate system and converts points to and from the display's coordinate grid. World2D is created with a minimum x and y value; this point corresponds in world space to the display's origin [0,0] (top, left corner). Rectangle (and any other object) coordinates represent the bottom left corner of the bounding box. World units can be represented on-screen to a varying scale using ppu (pixels-per-unit). This allows the implementer to specify how many pixels should represent one full unit in the 2D world.

    World coordinates are stored as double values and are rounded to int values on each conversion. It is therefore recommended that you always keep Entities, physics and game logic based on your 2D world coordinate system. Repeatedly converting and back-converting between world and screen coordinates will, naturally, cause significant precision loss due to decimal rounding.
    Since:
    Snap2D 1.0
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Constructor Detail

      • World2D

        public World2D(double minX,
       double maxY,
       int viewWidth,
       int viewHeight,
       float ppu)
        Creates this World2D with the specified starting x,y coordinates and view size.
        Parameters:
        minX - the current minimum value for x in world space; corresponds to x=0 in screen space.
        maxY - the current maximum value for y in world space; corresponds to y=0 in screen space.
        viewWidth - the width of the area on screen to which world coordinates should be translated
        viewHeight - the height of the area on screen to which world coordinates should be translated.
        ppu - the number of pixels per unit in world space

        public void setViewSize(int viewWidth,

               float ppu)
        Sets the dimensions and scale of the world's view.
        Parameters:
        viewWidth - the new width of the area drawn on screen
        viewHeight - the new height of the area drawn on screen
        ppu - the new pixels per unit of world space.

      • convertWorldRect

        public Rectangle convertWorldRect(Rect2D r)
        Converts the given Rect2D representing bounds in world space to corresponding Rectangle bounds in screen space. This method first converts the x,y coordinates, then scales the rectangle by this World2D's current pixels-per-unit value.
        Parameters:
        r -
        Returns:

      • convertScreenRect

        public Rect2D convertScreenRect(Rectangle r)
        Converts the given Rectangle representing bounds in screen space to corresponding Rect2D bounds in world space. This method first converts the x,y coordinates, then scales the rectangle by this World2D's current pixels-per-unit value.
        Parameters:
        r -
        Returns:

      • checkCollision

        public Rect2D checkCollision(Rect2D r1,
                    Rect2D r2)
        Checks for a collision between the two rectangles and returns the calculated area of collision (if one exists).
        Parameters:
        r1 - rectangle to test for collision with second
        r2 - rectangle to test for collision with first
        Returns:
        a rectangle representing the overlap of the two rectangles in world space.

      • viewContains

        public boolean viewContains(Rect2D rect)
        Checks if the given Rect2D is fully contained within this World2D's viewport. Algorithm is inclusive of values along the viewport's edge bounds.
        Parameters:
        rect - the bounding box in world coordinates to check.
        Returns:
